entry.title: Vulnerabilities in the X-Content-Type-Options and Referrer-Policy headers
entry.content:
Hello,

To fix the vulnerabilities in the "X-Content-Type-Options" and "Referrer-Policy" headers, we modified the following setting in the DEFAULT profile:

icm/HTTP/mod_0 = PREFIX=/, FILE=$(DIR_GLOBAL)/security/data/icm_filter_rules.txt

Then we entered the following entries in the "icm_filter_rules.txt" file at the OS level:

SetResponseHeader X-Content-Type-Options nosniff SetResponseHeader

Referrer-Policy strict-origin-when-cross-origin

Then we restarted SAP and the ICM.

This change was visible on the BW system (Kernel 7.54, SAP NW 7.50, SAP Basis 750) but not on the SRM system (Kernel 722, SAP NW 7.0, SAP Basis 731): In SMICM, the icm/HTTP/mod_0 parameter is clearly visible in BW but not in SRM. 

Question:

Is this related to the kernel version? How can I correct these settings in the SRM system? 

 

Regards.

entry.title: Re: Net price condition type for Intercompany billing
entry.content:
What exactly should the net price condition represent? Is it just gross minus discounts? Should it include freight or taxes?

Answer - Netprice should represent netprice-discounts+taxes

Where should this net price appear? In the STO pricing screen? In the billing document?

Answer - In the STO as well as in the billing document. STO to show that the transfer price and billing document to bill between 2 entities

Why must it be non-editable? Is it for audit control? To prevent manual overrides?

Answer - Yes for audit control. We wanted an autopopulated condition to show the netprice

entry.title: Automatic creation of PR for components when production order is created
entry.content:
Hello experts,

I‚Äôm working on a Make-to-Order (MTO) process in SAP S/4HANA where a production order is created automatically at the moment of sales order creation.

Here‚Äôs the current setup and behavior:

  • The finished good (FG) is set to Individual/Collective indicator = 1 (Individual requirements).

  • A production order is created automatically when the sales order is saved.

  • The BOM components have item category ‚ÄúL‚Äù (stock item) and procurement type ‚ÄúF‚Äù (external procurement).

  • At production order creation, the system generates reservations for these components.

  • When I run MRP, the system correctly creates purchase requisitions for those reservations, and each PR is account-assigned to the sales order (special stock ‚ÄúE‚Äù).

Is there a way through standard configuration to trigger automatic PR creation for stock components linked to a sales order (special stock ‚ÄúE‚Äù) at the time of production order creation, without running MRP?

#PP  #MRP  #MakeToOrder  #PurchaseRequisition

entry.title: Adaptation Project: How to make filter items mandatory for SAP standard Fiori apps
entry.content:
1. Introduction

SAP standard Fiori apps are used as important tools to support business processes using S/4HANA, and many apps are available that use the implementation technology of the Fiori Elements framework. However, to fully address the company's specific business requirements and specific user needs, it may be necessary to customize the standard app.
Several techniques are offered for Fiori app customization, including metadata extension and UI adaptation. However, if the object to be extended does not support metadata extension, or there may be business requirements that cannot be met by UI adaptation changes. In such cases, a more flexible UI extension method is the Adaptation Project (Developer Adaptation). With Adaptation Project, you can extend standard SAP Fiori elements applications without modification. This means that new application variants can be created and customized to meet unique requirements without modifying the original application.

Adaptation Project: how to change the mandatory input filter in SAP standard Fiori AppAdaptation Project: how to change mandatory input filter in SAP standard Fiori App>In this blog, we will create an Adaptation Project using SAP Business Application Studio to create an Adaptation Project for the requirements that filter field (Plant) defined as mandatory in the SAP Standard Fiori app (F0842A: Manage Purchase Orders). We'll walk you through the specific steps to add Annotation to customize your standard app.

 

2. Implementation method

1. Access SAP Business Application Studio and open the dev space of SAP Fiori.

 

2. Open Folder to access the Projects folder (/home/user/projects/).

 

 

 

3. Open New Project from Template from file and select SAPUI5 Adaptation Project.

 

 

 

4. In System and Application Selection, enter the following, and then click Next to proceed with the settings.

System: Destination to S/4HANA for the extended application
Application: Extended apps (for this blog, Manage Purchase Orders)

 

5. Enter the following information in Project Attributes:

Project Name: Any project name
Application Title: Any app title
Namespace: Auto-generated based on the project name you enter (can be changed if necessary).
Project Folder Path:P auto-populates the path to the rojects folder (you can change it if needed).
SAPUI5 Version: Auto-populates the latest SAPUI5 version (here, you can't change it. If you want to change to the SAPUI5 version installed on S/4HANA, you will need to change the ui5.yaml file after the project is generated. For more information, see SAP KBA:3095848 - How to change SAPUI5 version if problems occur for Adaptation Project in BAS.
Add Deployment Configuration: Yes

 

6. After entering the following information in the Deployment Configuration, click the Finish button to generate the project.

Destination: Auto-populates the Destination selected in System and Application Selection (you can change it if necessary).
Select How You Want to Enter the Package: Choose either Enter Manually / Choose from Existing to select the package for deployment.
Package: Select the package for deployment (screenshot shows a local package as an example).

 

 

 

7. Right-click on the generated project to generate an annotation file from Add Local Annotation File (also available from the Add Local Annotation File button in Application Information).

 

 

 

8. In the Add Local Annotation File, enter the following information:

Target OData Service: mainService (Autofill)
Annotation XML: Create local annotation file from template (if creating a new one) / Select annotation file from workspace (When referencing an existing annotation file)

 

 

9. A new annotation file will be created under webapp/changes/annotations in the project folder, so it will be opened.

 

 

10. Add the following annotation implementation to the annotation file (details of the implementation are described in the next section):

<edmx:Edmx xmlns:edmx="http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/ns/edmx" Version="4.0">
    <edmx:Reference Uri="https://sap.github.io/odata-vocabularies/vocabularies/Common.xml">
        <edmx:Include Namespace="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1" Alias="Common"/>
    </edmx:Reference>
    <edmx:Reference Uri="https://sap.github.io/odata-vocabularies/vocabularies/UI.xml">
        <edmx:Include Namespace="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1" Alias="UI"/>
    </edmx:Reference>
    <edmx:Reference Uri="https://sap.github.io/odata-vocabularies/vocabularies/Communication.xml">
        <edmx:Include Namespace="com.sap.vocabularies.Communication.v1" Alias="Communication"/>
    </edmx:Reference>
    <edmx:Reference Uri="/sap/opu/odata/sap/MM_PUR_PO_MAINT_V2_SRV/$metadata">
        <edmx:Include Namespace="MM_PUR_PO_MAINT_V2_SRV"/>
    </edmx:Reference>
    <edmx:Reference Uri="/sap/opu/odata/iwfnd/catalogservice;v=2/Vocabularies(TechnicalName='%2FIWBEP%2FVOC_CAPABILITIES',Version='0001',SAP__Origin='')/$value">
          <edmx:Include Namespace="Org.OData.Capabilities.V1" Alias="Capabilities"/>
    </edmx:Reference>
    <edmx:DataServices>
        <Schema xmlns="http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/ns/edm" Namespace="local_1760320506713">
            <Annotations Target="MM_PUR_PO_MAINT_V2_SRV.MM_PUR_PO_MAINT_V2_SRV_Entities/C_PurchaseOrderTP"> 
                <Annotation Term="Capabilities.FilterRestrictions"> 
                    <Record> 
                        <PropertyValue Property="RequiresFilter" Bool="true"/> 
                        <PropertyValue Property="RequiredProperties"> 
                            <Collection> 
                                <PropertyPath>Plant</PropertyPath> 
                            </Collection> 
                        </PropertyValue> 
                    </Record> 
                </Annotation> 
            </Annotations>
        </Schema>
    </edmx:DataServices>
</edmx:Edmx>

 

 

 

11. Add definitions for your app to reference the app's additional annotations in the manifest.appdescr_variant file.

 

 

{
  "fileName": "manifest",
  "layer": "CUSTOMER_BASE",
  "fileType": "appdescr_variant",
  "reference": "ui.ssuite.s2p.mm.pur.po.manage.st.s1",
  "id": "customer.zapp.f0842a",
  "namespace": "apps/ui.ssuite.s2p.mm.pur.po.manage.st.s1/appVariants/customer.zapp.f0842a/",
  "version": "0.1.0",
  "content": [
    {
      "changeType": "appdescr_ui5_addNewModelEnhanceWith",
      "content": {
        "modelId": "i18n"
      },
      "texts": {
        "i18n": "i18n/i18n.properties"
      }
    },
    {
      "changeType": "appdescr_ui5_addNewModelEnhanceWith",
      "content": {
        "modelId": "@i18n"
      },
      "texts": {
        "i18n": "i18n/i18n.properties"
      }
    },
    {
      "changeType": "appdescr_ui5_addNewModelEnhanceWith",
      "content": {
        "modelId": "i18n|sap.suite.ui.generic.template.ListReport|C_PurchaseOrderTP"
      },
      "texts": {
        "i18n": "i18n/ListReport/C_PurchaseOrderTP/i18n.properties"
      }
    },
    {
      "changeType": "appdescr_ui5_addNewModelEnhanceWith",
      "content": {
        "modelId": "i18n|sap.suite.ui.generic.template.ObjectPage|C_PurchaseOrderTP"
      },
      "texts": {
        "i18n": "i18n/ObjectPage/C_PurchaseOrderTP/i18n.properties"
      }
    },
    {
      "changeType": "appdescr_ui5_addNewModelEnhanceWith",
      "content": {
        "modelId": "i18n|sap.suite.ui.generic.template.ObjectPage|C_PurchaseOrderItemTP"
      },
      "texts": {
        "i18n": "i18n/ObjectPage/C_PurchaseOrderItemTP/i18n.properties"
      }
    },
    {
      "changeType": "appdescr_ui5_addNewModelEnhanceWith",
      "content": {
        "modelId": "i18n|sap.suite.ui.generic.template.ObjectPage|C_PurchaseOrderLimitItemTP"
      },
      "texts": {
        "i18n": "i18n/ObjectPage/C_PurchaseOrderLimitItemTP/i18n.properties"
      }
    },
    {
      "changeType": "appdescr_ui5_setMinUI5Version",
      "content": {
        "minUI5Version": "1.114.9"
      }
    },
    {
      "changeType": "appdescr_app_setTitle",
      "content": {},
      "texts": {
        "i18n": "i18n/i18n.properties"
      }
    },
    { 
      "changeType": "appdescr_app_addAnnotationsToOData", 
      "content": { 
        "dataSourceId": "mainService", 
        "annotations": [ "customer.myAnno" ], 
        "annotationsInsertPosition": "END", 
        "dataSource": { 
          "customer.myAnno": { 
            "uri": "changes/annotations/annotation_1760320506713.xml", 
            "type": "ODataAnnotation" 
          } 
        } 
      } 
    }
  ]
}

 

 

 

12. Right-click on the webapp > preview the app from the Preview Application (also from the Preview Application button in the Application Information).

 

 

13. Verify that the plant field is a required field.

 

 

14. Deploy the app from Deploy Application by right-clicking on the webapp (also from the Deploy button in Application Information).

 

 

 

15. Deployed apps (app variants) can be used by end users by defining Semantic objects, semantic actions, SAPUI5 Components, tiles, etc. in the Fiori technical catalog and referencing them from the business catalog and business roles.

Semantic Object: Any semantic Object
Action: Any semantic action
SAPUI5 Component ID: Namespace when generating a project in Step.5

 

3. Explanation of implementation details

1. Local Annotation fileÔºàannotation_xxx.xmlÔºâ

A local annotation file is a file that implements annotated extensions to the OData service used by standard Fiori apps. The description in the file is based on the syntax of OData, and there are the following restrictions (some excerpts).

  • edmx:Edmx
    • It is the root element, and between <edmx:Edmx> ~ </edmx:Edmx>, it writes the syntax. The definition of <edmx:Edmx> must include a description of Version and <edmx:DataServices> element.
  • edmx:Reference
    • Specifies an external Common Schema Definition Language (CSDL) document that is referenced in the annotation file. The child element edmx:Reference must contain a description of the Uri (the referenced URI) and at least one edmx:Include element.
  • edmx:Include
    • Specifies the schema under the CSDL document to be referenced. Namespace. You can also specify Alias.
  • edmx:Dataservices
    • An element that describes the properties of the Annotation, etc., and must contain a single Schema element. Write annotations in the Schema element.
  • Annotations
    • Specify the target attribute that contains the EntitySet name of the OData service you want to extend. It must contain at least one Annotation element.

According to these syntax, we have implemented that the filter field of the plant must be entered.

  • Identifying Targets for Expansion
    The implementation of this blog requires the following Target information:
  1. TargetÔºöMM_PUR_PO_MAINT_V2_SRV.MM_PUR_PO_MAINT_V2_SRV_Entities/C_PurchaseOrderTP
    • OData Service Name: MM_PUR_PO_MAINT_V2_SRV
    • EntityContainer Name: MM_PUR_PO_MAINT_V2_SRV_Entities
    • EntitySet Name: C_PurchaseOrderTP (*Not EntityType Name)
  2. PropertyPathÔºöPlant
  3. OData Service Name: SAP Fiori Apps Reference LibraryÔºàhttps://fioriappslibrary.hana.ondemand.com/sap/fix/externalViewer/#) to search for the Fiori app you want to expand. The OData used in the Fiori app is listed in the OData Service under "Configuration" in the "IMPLEMENTATION INFORMATION" tab of the app's page.

4. EntityContainer Name
Check the metadata of the OData service using the app (https://<IP Adress>:<Port Number>/sap/opu/odata/sap/ MM_PUR_PO_MAINT_V2_SRV/$metadata)„ÄÇ
You can find the EntityContainer name by searching for EntityContainer.

 

5. EntitySet name
When you start the Fiori app "Manage Purchase Orders", if you check the Preview/Response of the request to manifest.appdescr in the browser's developer tools, the entity set used for the List Report is "C_ PurchaseOrderTP".

6. PropertyPath
You can identify the item name (PropertyPath) by checking the definition of the target entity set in the metadata of the target OData service.

 

  • Setting Extension Target and Annotation Change Properties
    1.  manifest.json load the metadata of the OData service "MM_PUR_PO_MAINT_V2_SRV" used for "Purchase Order Management" and set the CDS View with the field to be extended by annotation to Target.
    2. The implementation uses FilterRestrictions to change the properties "RequiresFilter" and "RequiredProperties", so that the FilterRestrictions are included in "Org.OData.Capabilities.V1". vocabulary is referenced by the specified alias.

 

2. manifest.appdescr_variant.json

manifest.appdescr_variant.json is a file that describes the objects available in the original app, and many settings refer to the manifest information of the standard app. If you want to add a local annotation file, set the following properties:

"dataSourceId": A property that specifies the OData service of interest, in this scenario it is "mainService".
"annotations": Specify the name of the annotation for the OData data source "mainService" that you specified. The name must start with "customer" (for example, "customer.myAnno").
"annotationsInsertPosition": "END". If not, they may be disabled by the server user and have no effect at all.
"dataSource": "Specify the annotation name that starts with "customer". If you specify a local annotation file created with "uri" and add "type" to OData, it will be "ODataAnnotation".

 

4. Summary

In this article, we have shown you how to create an Adaptation Project in SAP Business Application Studio and add Local Annotation to make filter fields mandatory. In addition to making filters mandatory, the Adaptation Project allows you to extend your annotation implementation, extend your controller, and add custom XML fragments. For more information about the Adaptation Project, please refer to the documentation in the References section.

 

References

SAP Help: Extending an SAP Fiori Application for an SAP S/4HANA or SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition
SAP Blog: Extending SAP-delivered SAP Fiori elements apps using adaptation projects to create SAP S/4HANA app variants
SAP KBA: https://me.sap.com/notes/3285957

entry.title: Accruals & Deductions for Casual/Hourly Workers
entry.content:
Hello SAP SuccessFactors Time Tracking Experts,

Is there any standard solution in SF to cover the accruals and deductions for casual/daily workers (especially in Retail sector across different countries).

Scenario : 

1. They do not have a fixed work schedule. So normally with 0 working hours across all days.  ---- So work schedule with all days as non-working days to be configured in SF.

2. Based on the time recorded in the time tracking, system to calculate the accruals for those employees. (So if worked 5 days 4 hours each in the last month, gets pro-rated accruals accordingly in days/hours based on business requirement). ---- Standard behavior with accrual logic based on Recorded Times.

3. But how can the deductions be handled when employee is applying for a vacation?

-- If accruals are in days,  and when employee applies for a leave for 15.10.2025, system will deduct 0 days as no planned working hours on that day, or 1 day if deduction is based on calendar days. But both are wrong, as normally the business requirement is to average out the no. of hours worked in the last 12 months and accordingly calculate the deduction quantity. (However it is not possible via the counting configuration to determine the average hours worked based on timesheet).

-- -- If accruals are in hours,  and when employee applies for a leave for 15.10.2025, system will not allow to put leave in hours as only full day absences are allowed for non-working days. And if a full day absence is applied, how will system know how many hours to deduct? Same problem with counting rule above.   In this case, only thing i can think of is to have another custom field asking employee to put the no.of hours he wants to request, and then use that in the counting rule as deduction.

Is there any standard way or any recommendations of handling this in SF?

@NeeleshKamath  @Volker_Ruof @PriyankaAgarwal 

Regards,

Mohit Somani

entry.title: How to Add a New Tab in ESS Portal for Time Event (Punch In/Out)
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

I am working on Employee Self-Service (ESS) in SAP Portal and I want to add a new tab in the ESS overview for Time Event, where employees can view and record Punch In / Punch Out times.

Here‚Äôs what I have done so far:

  1. Created a Web Dynpro ABAP Component (Z_HRESS_TIME_EVENT) with:

    • From Date / To Date input

    • Punch In / Punch Out buttons

    • Table showing history of time events

  2. Exposed it as a Web Dynpro Application (Z_HRESS_TIME_EVENT_APP) in SE80, which runs perfectly when tested directly.

  3. In LPD_CUST, I created a new folder under the same Role / Instance as other tabs (Working Time, Personal Information, Benefits) and added my application there.

Problem / Question:

When I log in to the ESS Portal, I do not see my new tab. I understand that the Portal shows tabs via iViews and role assignments.

I want to know:

  • How can I create an iView for my Web Dynpro application and assign it to the ESS Role / Workset in the Portal?

  • Can this be done without Portal Admin access, or do I need someone with admin rights?

  • Are there best practices for adding Time Event tabs in ESS overview for punch in/out functionality?

Any guidance, example steps, or references would be very helpful!

Thanks in advance.

#SAP #ABAP #WebDynpro #ESS #SAPPortal #EmployeeSelfService #LPD_CUST #FPM

entry.title: Third Time's a Charm: SAP Customer Engagement Initiative 2025 Cycle 3 Now Live!
entry.content:
All good things come in threes, and we‚Äôre excited to share that the third cycle of the SAP Customer Engagement Initiative for 2025 is now live! This cycle features 47 new projects, offering SAP customers and partners the opportunity to gain early insights into product developments and actively collaborate with SAP teams to shape the future of SAP solutions.

üóìRegistration is open until November 14, 2025

In a rapidly evolving business landscape, being at the forefront of discussions can make a tangible impact. The SAP Customer Engagement Initiative gives you the chance to work directly with SAP product managers and developers, sharing your feedback on ideas, prototypes, and plans while they‚Äôre still in the initial phases.

To help you explore the available projects, we‚Äôve compiled a detailed list for your convenience. Check out the full list here or follow the links below to discover the exciting opportunities:

SAP Ariba

  • Asset Administration Shell (AAS) with SAP Business Network Asset Collaboration

SAP Business Technology Platform

  • Adoption of the SAP Job Scheduling service and it's new capabilities
  • AI-assisted message monitoring agent for SAP Integration Suite
  • Attachment handling made easy with SAP Document Management service CAP Plugin
  • CAP Apps and SAP BTP Kyma Runtime Environment
  • Effortlessly manage you documents using SAP Document Management service mobile application
  • Improving the Admin's and Solution Architect's Experience on SAP BTP
  • SAP Discovery Center: Long-Term User Research Initiative
  • Shape the future of job orchestration capabilities in SAP Build Process Automation

entry.title: Re: Posting of Recognized Revenue for Cost‚ÄëBased Percenta...
entry.content:
Hello @summy

Please note that the most common causes of Recognised Revenue remaining at 0 JPY while Recognised COS posts correctly under the EPMFC key are:

  • Your planned revenue is not linked to the same WBS/billing element where the recognition key is assigned.
  • Your planned data is maintained in a different ledger or planning category,
  • Your revenue account mapping is missing in the Assign G/L Accounts for Revenue Recognition configuration step or,
  • Your project was not revaluated after changes to your plan data. Ensure you rerun Revaluation in the app.

I advice to carry out those steps and that should display the expected 10,000,000 JPY recognised revenue.

Let me know if you have any questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: SAP Analytics Cloud compass Support of Seamless Planning & Live Version
entry.content:
One of the most often feedback received since SAP Analytics Cloud compass' general release is the ability to simulate with data from SAP Datasphere. With the coming Q4 2025 release, this will become reality.

The benefits are obvious: The support of seamless planning setup including live version connections will mean that users can do away with data redundancy and streamline data management workflow with the confidence that the compass simulations performed are always based on a single source of truth, the latest data, even if it is residing in SAP Datasphere, at any point in time. And as we all know: When it comes to simulations, this level of confidence is pivotal for the usefulness of the insights generated. 

To learn more about seamless planning and the setting up of a live version connection, I highly recommend checking out @Max_Gander's blog post with use cases, benefits and FAQ: Unlocking the Next Chapter of Seamless Planning in SAP Business Data Cloud with Live Versions. Once that is all set up, compass users will be able to perform Monte Carlo Simulation directly on the live version. Below you can see an example of creating a simulation with the version "Plan00", a live version. You can see there is basically no difference between the handling of scenarios based on a live or native version, and there is free choice to base your scenarios on any of the available versions.




An important detail here: Users will also be notified upon data changes in live versions. In the below example you can see that a change is made to the original data, a CSV file, which is then uploaded into the local table in SAP Datasphere, upon which the view for the live version is generated. When this change is deployed, compass will be able to detect the difference in baseline value and reflect the change in the driver list. 

With the support for seamless planning AND live version connection, compass is enabling more flexibility in setup and shortening the time-to-insight to a greater extent than before.

entry.title: Re: Ship to party
entry.content:
I have resolved the issue after so many hit & try.

The Solution

After a long trial period and several failed attempts, I finally found a sequence that worked perfectly.

Here‚Äôs the approach that successfully created the desired Sold-To and Ship-To mapping:

Step-by-Step Process

  1. Upload the Ship-To Parties Completely
    • Use the Customer Master migration template to upload all Ship-To customers first.
    • Ensure they contain all relevant General Data and Sales Data so they exist fully in the system.
  2. Upload the Sold-To Party
    • Create only the General Data for your Sold-To customers (do not include sales data at this point).
    • This ensures the system recognizes the Sold-To customer as existing but not yet extended to the sales and distribution role.
  3. Use the Extend Template ‚Äì Customer: Extend Existing Record by New Org Level
    • In this template, now extend the Sold-To Party by adding its Sales Data.
    • In the Partner Function tab, maintain the Ship-To Parties you uploaded earlier.
    • Make sure all mapping is done using system-generated BP numbers, not legacy numbers.

By following this sequence, the system accepts the records successfully ‚Äî even for the same sales area ‚Äî and links all Ship-To Parties to their respective Sold-To Party automatically.

Ô∏è Example Screenshots

General Data Tab

 

Sales data tab

 

Partner Function Tab

Regards,

Tehreem Fatima

entry.title: Re: Automatic creation of PR for components when producti...
entry.content:
No, in standard, requisitions for externally procured stock components (item category ‚ÄúL‚Äù, procurement type ‚ÄúF‚Äù) linked to a sales order (special stock ‚ÄúE‚Äù) are not created automatically at production order creation ‚Äî they require MRP to be run.

Why MRP is required because, in your Make-to-Order (MTO) setup, the production order creates reservations for BOM components. These reservations are for special stock ‚ÄúE‚Äù (sales order stock). SAP standard logic does not trigger PR creation directly from reservations ‚Äî it relies on MRP to evaluate the reservations and generate the corresponding purchase requisitions. This behavior is by design to allow MRP to consider:

  • Component availability
  • Lead times
  • Lot sizing
  • Procurement strategies

entry.title: How to find specific rights for User Security using Query Builder?
entry.content:
I am attempting to build a utility that can assign the desired security across the SAP environment. Currently I am testing setting the user security for a User Group on a Universe and have set some of the rights, but one in particular is not working. So I am wondering what object is storing those rights so I can try to identify what went wrong and ig I maybe have an incorrect ID.

This was an old utility I am attempting to update.

GetUniverse() successfully queries to get the targeted universe and the rights are all being set as expected except UniverseDataAccessRight. I don't know what the IDs that are assigned to the consts represent, but using them as a SI_ID did not find anything on CI_SYSTEMOBJECTS, CI_APPOBJECTS, or CI_INFOOBJECTS . If someone could tell me where the rights exist I could probably work out why its not assigning like the others

 

EDIT: Actually I was wrong about UniverseCreateEditQueryRight applying correctly. It is using an inherited right, not the one being set by the code. So neither are being set as intended. So still need to know what I need to access.

 

private const int UniverseDataAccessRight = 17367047;
private const int UniverseDataConnectionAccessRight = 19857415;
private const int UniverseCreateEditQueryRight = 17367048;

private string UpdateUniverseSecurity(string universeName, out string universeCuid)
{
string actionText = string.Empty;

InfoObjects universes = GetUniverse(universeName, ref actionText);


if (universes.Count == 1)
{
universeCuid = universes[1].CUID;
actionText += $"Setting security on universe \"{universeName}\".";

var advisorUserGroupPrincipal = universes[1].SecurityInfo.ObjectPrincipals.Add(AdvisorUsersGroup.ID);
advisorUserGroupPrincipal.Rights.AddSystemRight((int)CeSystemRights.ceRightView).Granted = true;
advisorUserGroupPrincipal.Rights.Add(UniverseDataAccessRight).Granted = true;
advisorUserGroupPrincipal.Rights.Add(UniverseCreateEditQueryRight).Granted = true;
universes[1].SecurityInfo.ObjectPrincipals.Add(EveryoneGroup.ID).Role = CeRole.ceRoleNoAccess;
IStore.Commit(universes);
}
else
universeCuid = string.Empty;

return actionText;
}

entry.title: DRTM Master Data Purge error: "There is no country specified for this user or user's country..."
entry.content:
The DRTM Master Data Purge requires prerequisites and configuration for a user to be successfully purged.

After you proceed with a DRTM Master Data Purge when you go to see the result, sometimes you see that the Purge is completed but you have the error "There is no country specified for this user or user's country is not DRM enabled.", meaning that the user was not purged and there is some misconfiguration.

And then you are wondering: what specifically is causing this error? How to verify this and correct for the Purge to be completed successfully? Is the Country missing? Is the Company Exit Date / Termination date missing? How to self-check and fix this for the Purge to be completed successfully?

Thinking about you and this scenario, we have developed the Troubleshooting DRTM Master Data Purge error: There is no country specified for this user or user's ... Guided Answers.

These Guided Answers were created with a step-by-step instructions and self-service troubleshooting to help you navigate the process and resolve the error on your own. These Guided Answers were inspired and created based on the methods that Product Support Team troubleshoot issues related to this error.

We hope you use it and your feedback is welcome for us to improve these Guided Answers further.

entry.title: Closing the Value Gap: Maximizing Share of Wallet and Reducing Contract Leakage
entry.content:
Share of wallet  

Share of wallet is the dollar amount a customer devotes to a particular supplier in a product category.  Suppliers try to maximize an existing customer's share of wallet by introducing multiple products and services to generate as much revenue as possible from each customer. A marketing campaign, for example, may have a stated goal of increasing the supplier‚Äôs wallet share for specific customers at the expense of its competitors. 

Benefits from increasing a customer‚Äôs share of wallet include added revenue, improved client retention, customer satisfaction and brand loyalty. 

Share of Wallet vs. Market Share 

Increasing wallet share can be a less expensive, more efficient, and therefore a more profitable strategy for suppliers to boost revenue rather than attempting to expand overall market share. It's important to note that wallet share and market share are two different concepts. Both market share and wallet share focus on growing revenue from customers. However, the growing market share focuses on attracting new clients from the competition. On the other hand, share of wallet focuses on growing revenue from existing clients by expanding the number of products being used‚Äìwhich might also be taken from the competition. 

Contract Value 

Contract value is the monetary value of a contract. It can range anywhere from a few hundred to millions of dollars. All of this depends on the work that is carried out or the products that are requested. Contract value also depends on the size of the customer that issues the initial proposal. A bid from an SME can be expected to have a lower contract value than a bid issued by a large enterprise trading on the SAP Business Network 

Contract Leakage 

Suppliers loose hundreds of thousands to millions of dollars through what is called contract leakage ‚Äî the difference between the expected contract value and the real value created in production. That difference can be enormous. According to the International Association for Contract & Commercial Management (IACCM), poor contract management costs companies up to 9% of their revenue.   

Depending on the supplier‚Äôs industry, customers may not commit to a specific contract value or annual turnover. When this occurs, suppliers focus on educating buyers about their actual spend and encouraging them to channel more spend through their e-procurement channels. Suppliers may offer incentives for reaching certain volume thresholds such and reduced handling charges.  

Problems 

Contract leakage is a problem for both buyers and suppliers including the following issues:

Suppliers  

  • Lost Opportunities/Revenue: Suppliers fail to capitalize on opportunities for existing work, additional work, extensions, or renewals.  
  • Cost Overruns: Poor return on investment in such areas as catalogue integration, transactional integration, marketing, promotions, unnecessary or obsolete inventory  

Buyers 

  • Cost Overruns: If leakage exceeds contracted value, the buyer may be ineligibles for negotiated price discounts or rebates. 
  • Missed goals: The buyer‚Äôs goals to consolidate spend, reduce supplier base, address compliance and process needs not met. 
  • Cost Overruns: Poor return on investment in such areas as catalogue integration, transactional integration, sourcing effort, contracting effort‚Ä¶. 

Buyers and suppliers 

  • Relationship Strain: Leakage can result in contractual disputes and strain relationships between parties, affecting collaboration, and potentially leading to contract/relationship terminations and increased costs. 

Typical Causes 

Contract leakage may be the result of any of the following root causes:

  • Lack of visibility: Lack of visibility into all spend data, making it difficult to track and manage all transactions.  Buyers may not understand the full range of a supplier‚Äôs capabilities. 
  • Lack of commitment: Buyers not committing to a contract value or annual turnover can lead to untracked spend and leakage. 
  • Ineffective Rollout Plans:‚ÄØPoorly executed rollout plans can lead to low adoption and confidence issues among users. 
  • Data Quality Issues:‚ÄØInadequate or incomplete data in catalogs can affect search results and product visibility, leading to leakage. 
  • Lack of Enforcement:‚ÄØBuyers not enforcing the adoption of new systems or allowing multiple supplier choices can result in continued use of previous vendors.  Customers using multiple purchasing channels, such as direct websites, instead of a single integrated platform.‚ÄØUsers deviating from the established procurement process and preferred suppliers.‚ÄØ  
  • System Integration Problems:‚ÄØTechnical issues during system integration can cause disruptions and affect order processing. 
  • External Factors:‚ÄØChanges in customer business models, economic conditions, or other external factors can impact demand and lead to leakage. 

These factors highlight the complexity of addressing contract leakage and the need for thorough analysis and collaboration between suppliers and buyers. 

Typical Remedies 

By implementing these strategies, buyers and suppliers can reduce leakage, improve contract compliance, and enhance overall performance:

  • Regular Business Reviews:‚ÄØConduct regular business reviews with sales sponsors and buy-side sponsors to compare contract promises with actual performance and identify areas for improvement. 
  • Improve Data Quality:‚ÄØEnsure robust and accurate catalog data to enhance search results and product visibility, making it easier for users to find and order products. 
  • Adoption Monitoring:‚ÄØImplement a dedicated team to perform regular health checks with customers, addressing adoption issues and improving system usage. 
  • Collaborative Target Setting:‚ÄØWork with buyers to set collaborative spend targets and monitor progress, addressing any discrepancies proactively. 
  • Benchmarking and Analysis:‚ÄØBenchmark performance against other channels and systems to identify best practices and areas for improvement.  
  • Supplier lists: Sharing suppliers lists with buyers may to help buyers consolidate their spend and improve transparency. Supplier lists may helps buyers achieve better volume bundling, leverage process efficiencies, and ultimately reduce costs. Sharing these lists also facilitates better collaboration and trust with buyers. 
  • Customer Feedback:‚ÄØGather anecdotal evidence and feedback from sales reps and customers to understand specific issues and develop targeted solutions. 
  • System Integration Support:‚ÄØProvide strong support during system integration to ensure smooth implementation and address any technical issues promptly. 
  • Educating Buyers: Informing customers about the full extent of their spend in specific categories and encouraging them to channel more of their spend through the supplier's platform. 
  • Offering Incentives: Providing incentives for buyers to reach certain volume thresholds. 
  • Blocking Non-Preferred Suppliers: Asking buyers to block certain suppliers in their system to ensure all relevant spend goes through the preferred supplier 

Conclusion

Maximizing share of wallet and minimizing contract leakage are both critical to realizing the full value of buyer‚Äìsupplier relationships. While expanding market share attracts new customers, increasing wallet share and strengthening contract compliance help suppliers unlock greater revenue potential from existing partnerships. Effective contract management, robust data quality, and transparent collaboration are essential to closing the gap between expected and realized contract value.

entry.title: Re: Combining MATID and MATNR field in CDS/AMDP
entry.content:
When joining the "MARA" table with "/SCWM/AQUA", you should link the SCWM-"MATID" with the MARA-"SCM_MATID_GUID16" ...
I believe this should not involve a conversion on your part ...

Something like below sample code should work :

define view ZTMP_TESTCDS
  as select from mara
    join /scwm/aqua on mara.scm_matid_guid16 = /scwm/aqua.matid
{
  mara.matnr       as Material,
  /scwm/aqua.matid as Material_Guid,
  mara.mtart       as MaterialType
}

Hope this helps

Nic T.

entry.title: Principal Propagation failing between BTP Mobile Services, Cloud Connector and S/4 HANA - Access Den
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I'm experiencing an issue with Principal Propagation when connecting SAP Mobile Development Kit (MDK) application through BTP Mobile Services to an on-premise S/4 HANA system via Cloud Connector.

Current Setup:

  • Source: SAP Mobile Services (BTP)
  • Middleware: SAP Cloud Connector
  • Target: SAP S/4 HANA on-premise (Client 400)

Problem Description:

When I configure the connection in Mobile Services to use "Cloud Connector SSO" as the SSO mechanism and try to test it using the "Launch in Browser" button, I receive the following error:

 
Access denied to system molinos.rise:8000. In case this was a valid request, ensure to expose the system correctly in your cloud connector.

However, the same OData service works perfectly when:

  1. Accessed directly from the S/4 HANA system browser
  2. Using a BTP Destination with Basic Authentication (username/password)

But it fails when using Principal Propagation authentication method.

Current Configuration:

Cloud Connector:

  • Principal Type: X.509 Certificate
  • Resources: / exposed with "Path And All Sub-Paths"

Connection to S/4 HANA: ‚úÖ Active

What I've Already Checked:

‚úÖ Cloud Connector can reach S/4 HANA system (green status) ‚úÖ OData service is active in SICF ‚úÖ Resource "/" is exposed in Cloud Connector ‚úÖ Virtual-to-internal host mapping is correct ‚úÖ Basic Authentication works (confirms the OData service itself is working) ‚úÖ Cloud Connector certificate appears to be in STRUST

Questions:

  • Is there any additional trust configuration needed between BTP, Cloud Connector, and S/4 HANA for X.509 certificate-based SSO?
  • Are there any specific authorizations my user needs in S/4 HANA to consume OData services via Principal Propagation? (Besides the standard OData consumption authorizations)

How can I verify that the Cloud Connector is correctly sending the certificate/user information to S/4 HANA?

Logs/Additional Info:

The error appears immediately when clicking "Launch in Browser" in Mobile Services. The Cloud Connector audit log shows the request is being blocked at the Cloud Connector level with the "Access denied" message.

Any guidance on the correct configuration steps or troubleshooting approach would be greatly appreciated!

Thank you in advance for your help.

Best regards

entry.title: Re: BAdI to change PMP0 value of PO Item
entry.content:
Hello @KhaingZinTun,

You cannot modify PMP0 through MM_PUR_S4_PO_MODIFY_ITEM because this BAdI does not influence pricing.
If you need to set or override the Manual Gross Price (PMP0) in a purchase order, use the relevant pricing BAdIs instead.

PRCG_DOC_ITEM_CONDITION_AMOUNT overrides the amount for a specific condition at the item level, filtering by Condition Type = 'PMP0'.

MM_PUR_S4_PO_DEFINE_CNDNCTR influences the price determination for PO items, like identifying which condition contributes.

Implement both in Custom Fields and Logic key-user extensibility. Make sure PMP0 is included in your purchasing schema and that it is allowed for manual or logic updates; otherwise, the BAdI will not work.

Useful SAP Documentation

SAP KBA 3580006 ‚Äì Purchase Order Price Enhancement ,explains using PRCG_DOC_ITEM_CONDITION_AMOUNT and MM_PUR_S4_PO_DEFINE_CNDNCTR. SAP Support Portal-3580006 - Purchase Order Price Enhancement in SAP S/HANA Cloud Public Edition

SAP KBA 2756560 ‚Äì Cloud BAdIs for Pricing Lists available pricing BAdIs and usage through Custom Fields and Logic. SAP Support Portal-2756560 - Cloud BAdIs for pricing

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: SAPUI5 Date Input and UTC Conversion
entry.content:
Hi everyone,
I‚Äôm currently working as a SAPUI5 developer, and I wanted to open up a discussion (and hopefully learn from you all) about a challenge I keep running into:
DATE HANDLING in UI5/Fiori apps.
Whenever I encounter date fields ‚Äî whether it's in forms, tables, filters, or while sending/receiving dates via OData ‚Äî I get a bit anxious üòÖ. It's not like I haven't dealt with it before, but there always seems to be some unexpected issue:
  • Timezone differences
  • Formatting inconsistencies (backend vs frontend)
  • OData model quirks (Edm.Date vs Edm.DateTimeOffset)
  • Date pickers showing wrong values
  • Converting to UTC and back again

Scenario 1 - Reading Date from Date Picker ==> Whenever user selects any date from date picker, I want to get the UTC date.

For example - I am working in IST time zone and if I select the date 17-Oct-2025 in date picker and when I read it in my change event handler I get the date as 17-Oct-2025 based on local time zone. But when I tried to get the UTC date, it will be 16-Oct-2025. 

My expectation is when user selects 17-Oct-2025 irrespective of  local time zone, model property(VALID_TO) will be set to UTC date '17-08-2025T00:00:00Z'. I am doing something like this to achieve this.

Date Picker Code in UI view - 

 

<DatePicker value="{path:'localModel>VALID_TO',type: 'sap.ui.model.type.Date', constraints: { displayFormat: 'Date' }, formatOptions: {pattern: 'yyyy-MM-dd',  strictParsing: true, UTC: true }}" change="handleDateChange"  />
 

Date Change Event Handler - HandleDateChange in Controller

handleDateChange: function (oEvent) {
        var source = oEvent.getSource(),
          oTable = source.getParent(),          
          contextRow = oTable.getBindingContext("LocalModel").getPath() + "/VALID_TO",
          inputValue = source.getDateValue();
          //Get the Local Date Converted to UTC
          let utcDate = new Date(Date.UTC(inputValue.getFullYear(),inputValue.getMonth(),inputValue.getDate()));
          console.log(utcDate);
          this.getModel('LocalModel').setProperty(contextRow, utcDate);
      }
 This is working as expected. Your thoughts on this and if there is better way of doing it.
 
Scenario 2 - Using formatter to convert date object to UTC
Formatter Code - Check if date is defined and is a Date Object then format it as per UTC. I want to know if this is correct or there is other way of doing it. Also are there any other conditions which I should add apart from checking date instance. Or this will work in all scenarios.
Scenario 3 - Checking if input/parameter passed is Valid Date Object- Anything else we need to check or some other way of checking it.
Code - 
checkDateObject: function (date) {
      return date instanceof Date && !isNaN(date.getTime());
    }

I would like to hear your thoughts on the common date scenarios mentioned above. Additionally, please inform me whether the code provided above is useful or not.

Thanks,

Dhiraj More

entry.title: Re: Supplier Rating App in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
entry.content:
Hello @Amit66 

You can use the standard Supplier Evaluation apps in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud for your scenario involving delivery schedules, shortages, and product quality; there's no need for a customised app.

Core evaluation apps (Version 2)

Supplier Evaluation by Time (F1664A) , evaluates delivery schedule adherence. (Based on the delivery and Goods Receipt Date)

Supplier Evaluation by Quantity (F1661A) , measures shortages and over or under-deliveries.

 

Supplier Evaluation by Quality (F3295A) , uses quality notifications and inspection results to score product quality.

 

 

Configuration and scoring documentation

  • Supplier Evaluation Weighting and Scoring (F2551). Define and assign importance to your KPIs (Time, Quantity, Quality) for an overall supplier score..
  • Manage User Defined Criteria for Supplier (F3812), optional; allows you to add your own evaluation dimensions.
  • Operational Supplier Evaluation (F1662A), view overall scores and explore detailed results.

These Apps are in the Purchasing Analytics and Supplier Management catalogues.

More useful SAP documentation

  • SAP Help Portal ‚Äì Supplier Evaluation and Scoring in Procurement
  • SAP Fiori Apps Library ‚Äì Supplier Evaluation by Quantity (Version 2)

With kind regards

Chuma
